Detailed Description

Definitions for SPE management layer.

Note:
On libspe2 or tSDK, SPE context provides 'light weight' mechanism as compared with SPE threads. However, on libspe, using SPE context won't make any difference from SPE threads in terms of performance. It still generates one PPE thread per one SPE thread.

Define Documentation

#define CTK_SPE_CFG_SIGNOTIFY1_OR   0x00000010

Flag for ctk_spe_context_create. (Borrowed from libspe spec.) Configure the Signal Notification 1 Register to be in "logical OR" mode instead of the default "Overwrite" mode.

#define CTK_SPE_CFG_SIGNOTIFY2_OR   0x00000020

Flag for ctk_spe_context_create. (Borrowed from libspe spec.) Configure the Signal Notification 2 Register to be in "logical OR" mode instead of the default "Overwrite" mode.

#define CTK_SPE_DEFAULT_ENTRY   0xffffffff

SPE default entry (for 2nd arg of ctk_spe_context_run)

#define CTK_SPE_ENV ( spe   )     (((ctk_spe_context_abstract_t *)spe)->m_env)

Macro to obtain SPE environment structure for the given SPE context.

Parameters:
[in] spe - SPE context
Returns:
an instance of ctk_env_t for the SPE
Note:
declared here mainly for documentation.

#define CTK_SPE_EXIT_SIGNAL ( status   )     WTERMSIG(status)

Returns the signal code which stopped the SPE (meaningful only if CTK_SPE_IF_EXITED(status) is false

Parameters:
[in] status - the SPE exit/stop status code returned via the 5th arg of ctk_spe_context_run.

#define CTK_SPE_EXIT_STATUS ( status   )     WEXITSTATUS(status)

Returns the SPE exit code (meaningful only if CTK_SPE_IF_EXITED(status) is true)

Parameters:
[in] status - the SPE exit/stop status code returned via the 5th arg of ctk_spe_context_run.

#define CTK_SPE_ID ( spe   )     (ctk_spe_id_t)CTK_SPE_NATIVE(spe)

Macro to obtain SPE context ID for the given SPE context.

Parameters:
[in] spe - SPE context
Returns:
the SPE context ID
Note:
declared here mainly for documentation.

#define CTK_SPE_IF_EXITED ( status   )     WIFEXITED(status)

Returns 1 (true) if the SPE has exited normally

Parameters:
[in] status - the SPE exit/stop status code returned via the 5th arg of ctk_spe_context_run.

#define CTK_SPE_NO_CALLBACKS   0x00000002

Flag for ctk_spe_context_run. (Borrowed from libspe2 spec.) Specifies that registered SPE library calls ("callbacks" from this library's view) should not be automatically executed. If a callback is encountered. This also disables callbacks that are predefined in the library implementation.

Note:
this flag will take no effect with libspe1.

#define CTK_SPE_RUN_USER_REGS   0x00000001

Flag for ctk_spe_context_run. (Borrowed from libspe2 spec.) Specifies that the SPE setup registers r3, r4, and r5 are initialized with the 48 bytes pointed to by argp.

#define CTK_SPE_STATUS ( spe   )     (((ctk_spe_context_abstract_t *)spe)->m_status)

Macro to obtain SPE status for the given SPE context.

Parameters:
[in] spe - SPE context
Returns:
an instance of ctk_env_t for the SPE
Note:
declared here mainly for documentation.

int ctk_spe_context_create ( ctk_spe_context_t *  spe,
unsigned int  flags,
void *  info 
)

Creates a new SPE context

Parameters:
[out] spe - pointer to store the created SPE context
[in] flags - A bit-wise OR of modifiers that are applied when the new context is created. 0 (no flag) or any combination of CTK_SPE_CFG_SIGNOTIFY1_OR and CTK_SPE_CFG_SIGNOTIFY2_OR can be specified.
[in] info - [reserved]
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, non-zero otherwise.

Destroys the given SPE context.

Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE context
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS on success, ERRNO on failure.

static int ctk_spe_context_get_status ( ctk_spe_context_t  spe  )  [inline, static]

Returns SPE status of the given SPE context.

Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE context
Returns:
either one of CTK_SPE_STATUS_CREATED, CTK_SPE_STATUS_LOADED, CTK_SPE_STATUS_READY, CTK_SPE_STATUS_RUNNING, CTK_SPE_STATUS_STOPPED or CTK_SPE_STATUS_UNKNOWN.

void *  addr

int ctk_spe_context_run ( ctk_spe_context_t  spe,
ls_addr_t *  entry,
unsigned int  runflags,
void *  argp,
void *  envp,
int *  status,
int *  stop_code 
)

Runs the given SPE context.

Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE context
[in,out] entry - the SPE context entry point (not supported on libspe1.) If you have no idea what value to specify, use CTK_SPE_DEFAULT_ENTRY.
[in] flags - A bit-wise OR of modifiers that are applied when the new context is created. 0 (no flag) or combination of CTK_SPE_RUN_USER_REGS and CTK_SPE_NO_CALLBACKS can be specified.
[in] argp - Argument pointer for the SPE (2nd arg of the SPE main)
[in] envp - Env pointer for the SPE (3rd arg of the SPE main)
[out] status - the SPE exit status. The return code of the SPE program can be obtained by a macro CTK_SPE_EXIT_STATUS(status) if CTK_SPE_IF_EXITED(status) is true.
[out] stop_code - the raw SPE stop code (not supported on libspe1)
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS on success, ERRNO on failure.
Note:
the entry and stop_code parameters are not supported on Libspe1.

int ctk_spe_context_stop ( ctk_spe_context_t  spe  ) 

Stops the given SPE context. (This operaton may not be support by low level libraries)

Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE context
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS on success, ERRNO on failure.
